descriptions: Teams net points while player is on the court.

article.description: Tracy McGrady scored 28 of his 32 points in the first half as the Orlando Magic manhandled the Atlanta Hawks, 129-94, on Friday to extend their season-high winning streak to four games.

related.description: The Magic could learn Tuesday whether star forward Grant Hill will need surgery -- his third operation in 20 months -- to repair his troublesome left ankle, the Orlando Sentinel reported.
related.linkText: Report: Magic could learn today if Hill needs surgery
related.title: Hill weighing options for troublesome ankle
related.headline: Hill weighing options for troublesome ankle

article.headline: Hawks play three quarters without Abdur-Rahim
article.linkText: McGrady scores 28 in first half, Magic coasts past Hawks
article.story:
ORLANDO, Fla. (AP) -- Life without Grant Hill hasn't been so bad for the Orlando Magic.
McGrady

Hours after placing Hill on the injured list, the Magic won their fourth straight game Friday night, defeating the Atlanta Hawks 129-94 behind 32 points from Tracy McGrady. "Oh man, we're playing great defense," McGrady said. "Guys are rotating and that's what going to win us games. Offensively, everything's clicking, we're all working together." The Hawks played without Shareef Abdur-Rahim for the last three quarters. The forward fell midway through the first quarter while trying for a rebound and left the game. He returned for less than a minute before leaving again. "He's a big, big part of their ball team and when he went down it was like they fell apart," McGrady said. "I don't know what his status is for Saturday," Atlanta coach Lon Kruger said. "He bruised his butt and then had muscle spasms. It all depends on how he responds to treatment tonight and tomorrow." Mike Miller added 22 points and Troy Hudson 20 for the Magic. Orlando outscored the Hawks 13-4 at the start of the second quarter to take a 49-33 lead with 7:46 to play in the second quarter. Behind McGrady's 28 points and a 27-15 advantage in rebounds, Orlando took a 70-44 lead into the locker room at the break. Terry had 14 points at the half. "I was in a big zone," McGrady said. "That's my game to make things happen and when the jump shot is on, it opens up everything else. When I'm on they're at my mercy." Terry had 21 points to lead Atlanta. Despite the lopsided Orlando win, Magic head coach Doc Rivers felt the Hawks would be back Saturday seeking revenge. "Obviously not having Abdur-Rahim hurt them," Rivers said. "Losing a key player like that is never easy, I know that from losing Grant. But we expect them to come at us hard Saturday night. "Back-to-back games are very hard to sweep and I know they'll be mad. They're going to come out and try to do the same thing to us." McGrady's 32 points were seven higher than his average. The Magic played the fourth quarter without their starters as they prepared for a six-game road trip, their longest of the season. McGrady's 21-foot jumper gave the Magic the lead for good, 19-18, with 4:07 left in the first quarter. Orlando held a 36-29 lead at the end of the first quarter. McGrady had 17 points in the first quarter for Orlando. Jason Terry had 12 for Atlanta.

Game notes
Hill has started 14 games for the Magic this season. To replace Hill, Orlando activated forward Monty Williams, who had been on the injured list since Nov. 9 with a strained right hamstring. ... The 124 points Orlando scored will their league-leading scoring average even higher. The Magic came into the game leading the NBA with an average of 102.7 points per game.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
